title: The Fed’s Next Chair Faces AI Uncertainty, Political Heat and Credit Risks
description: The Federal Reserve has just cut rates by 25 basis points into an economy it still expects to grow faster next year, raising questions about why it eased and how much further it can go. Former Council of Economic Advisers chair Glenn Hubbard discusses the decision, the neutral rate and why he doesn’t see much more room for rate cuts going into 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)
